required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Microbiome Alterations in IL10RA-deficient Patients After HSCT
clinical_study.official_title: Longitudinal Development of Intestinal Microbiome in IL10RA-deficient Patients After Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation

brief_summary.textblock: To elucidate the longitudinal development of intestinal microbiota in patients with IL10RA deficiency after hematopoietic stem cell transplantation (HSCT). The investigators planned to collect fecal samples from IL10RA-deficient patients who received HSCT. Samples were collected more than once every three days after engraftment in lamina flow ward and at least once a week before discharge. Microbial DNA was extracted from the fecal samples. And all analysis was based on the next generation sequencing data.

detailed_description.textblock: Hematopoietic stem cell transplantation is considered the only curative therapy for patients with interleukin-10 receptor-A(IL10RA) deficiency. The investigators aimed to collect the fecal samples of these patients throughout the conditioning, transplantation until discharge, providing a dense insight into the longitudinal development of intestinal microbiota.

primary_outcome.time_frame: during the hospitalization of each eligible patient, an average of 90 days per patient
primary_outcome.description: Shannon index is a popular diversity index in the ecological literature; minimum score is zero, higher values represent a better outcome

arm_group.description: IL10RA-deficient patients who received hematopoietic stem cell transplantation

intervention.description: Reduced intensity conditioning(RIC) chemotherapy regimen before transplantation All patients were cared for in single rooms ventilated with a highly effective particulate air filtration system. All patients received intravenous immunoglobulin and antimicrobial prophylaxis, which included antiviral, antifungal, and Pneumocystis jirovecii prophylaxis with ganciclovir and micafungin, as per routine clinical practice before transplantation. Umbilical cord blood transplantation

study_pop.textblock: Patients who were diagnosed with IL10RA deficiency and who received the hematopoietic stem cell transplantation in a tertiary hospital were enrolled.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- IL10RA gene mutations;
- Eligible for hematopoietic stem cell transplantation.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unwilling to participate.

results_reference.citation: Peng K, Qian X, Huang Z, Lu J, Wang Y, Zhou Y, Wang H, Wu B, Wang Y, Chen L, Zhai X, Huang Y. Umbilical Cord Blood Transplantation Corrects Very Early-Onset Inflammatory Bowel Disease in Chinese Patients With IL10RA-Associated Immune Deficiency. Inflamm Bowel Dis. 2018 Jun 8;24(7):1416-1427. doi: 10.1093/ibd/izy028.

responsible_party.investigator_title: The director of gastroenterology of Children's Hospital of Fudan University
